cardContent.title: Belcher Bay Promenade
info:
Transformed from a disused public cargo working area, the Promenade was opened in phases between March 2019 and October 2020. Apart from providing a leisure space for enjoying the panoramic view of the Victoria Harbour and the sunset, the project embodies multiple goals of harbourfront enhancement e.g. making good use of vacant harbourfront sites, implementation of an 'incremental approach', introduction of multiple harbourfront experiences, and open site management.

Photo source:
Planning Department

marker.name:
Open Space at
Eastern Street North
in Sai Ying Pun

cardContent.title: Open Space at Eastern Street North in Sai Ying Pun
info:
The Open Space is being developed under the “incremental approach”, with the first phase of works completed in 2019 with the site opened to public under the theme of WE Park. Based on on-site observations by the project team, and collection of visitors’ experience and suggestions through user survey, enhancements such as sufficient shading, intergenerational and inclusive play facilities, and multi-purpose area etc. have been suitably incorporated into the next stage of works, which are expected to be completed by phases starting 2024.

Photo source:
Central and Western District Council

marker.name:
Central and Western District Promenade - Western Wholesale
Food Market Section

cardContent.title: Central and Western District Promenade - Western Wholesale Food Market Section
info:
In the 2013 Policy Address, the Chief Executive announced the Signature Project Scheme (SPS). After discussion and public engagement exercise, the Central and Western District Council decided to pursue “Harbourfront Enhancement and Revitalisation at the Western Wholesale Food Market” as its SPS project. The promenade was opened in April 2018, providing running space and elderly exercise facilities, and four piers with different themes, creating a unique pier-turned-park. The project’s design has preserved the distinctive features, historical elements and piers, highlighting the characteristics of wholesale trade and history of the district.

Photo source:
Planning Department

cardContent.title: New Central Harbourfront
info: The New Central Harbourfront comprises the Tamar Park and the Central and Western District Promenade – Central Section managed by the Government, and the Central Harbourfront Event Space, the Hong Kong Observation Wheel and the Hong Kong Maritime Museum run by private operators.  The diverse management models help tap fully into the creativity, wisdom and experience of the community and market for bringing about an attractive and vibrant harbourfront.

marker.name:
Promenade between Tamar and the
Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre

cardContent.title:
Promenade between Tamar and the
Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre
info: The waterfront section of the promenade was opened in October 2019, for part of the longest harbourfront promenade within the Victoria Harbour by far.  The next phase completed in May 2021 comprises a children’s play area under the theme “Funscape” and a meandering green corridor etc.  Interactive, “pop-up” installations by local creative talents are also displayed along the promenade from time to time.

marker.name: Celebration Precinct in Wan Chai North

cardContent.title: Celebration Precinct in Wan Chai North
info:
The design objective of the Precinct is to enhance the harbourfront already opened to the public as a place that the locals and visitors can easily access to enjoy the panoramic harbour views and as a solemn venue for official celebration / ceremonial events.

Photo source:
Planning Department

marker.name: Pierside Precinct in Wan Chai North

cardContent.title: Pierside Precinct in Wan Chai North
info:
The Precinct was opened by phases starting end 2020. In order to better capture the magnificent harbour view, a design concept with photo frames and neon lights has been used to decorate the new space, offering lots of check-in spots for photo shooting. Visitors can not only take photos with berthing Star Ferry vessels and Tsim Sha Tsui on the opposite side of the harbour as backdrops, but may also carry out a diverse range of activities at the many spacious covered areas.

Photo source:
Wan Chai District Council

marker.name: Water Sports and Recreation Precinct in Wan Chai North

cardContent.title: Water Sports and Recreation Precinct in Wan Chai North
info:
The Precinct was opened by phases starting end 2020. In order to bring people closer to the water, a set of harbour steps would be introduced along with slipway and railways which can be disassembled to facilitate the loading of boats. Apart from fostering water sports activities at Victoria Harbour, the Precinct is also an ideal venue for displaying “pop-up” installations and carrying out a diverse range of activities.

Photo source:
Development Bureau

marker.name: Revitalised Typhoon Shelter Precinct in Causeway Bay

cardContent.title: Revitalised Typhoon Shelter Precinct in Causeway Bay
info:
The promenade near Victoria Park Road is being enhanced and a new set of harbour steps will be introduced for bringing people closer to the water. Construction works are expected to be completed by phases starting from end 2021.

Photo source:
Development Bureau

marker.name: East Coast Park Precinct in Fortress Hill

cardContent.title: East Coast Park Precinct in Fortress Hill
info:
Part of the site will be released from works project early and open for public use starting end 2021 after beautification. The winning entry of the "Victoria Harbour" Word Art Competition will be displayed there. About 40 m in height and 3m in width, the artwork will be clearly visible within the Harbour.

Photo source:
Development Bureau

marker.name: Boardwalk underneath the Island Eastern Corridor

cardContent.title: Boardwalk underneath the Island Eastern Corridor
info:
The harbourfront from Fortress Hill to Quarry Bay are occupied by private residential and commercial developments, public facilities, operating piers and the Island Eastern Corridor (IEC), with some parts not being publicly accessible. By building a walkway over the water area along the harbourfront, the proposed Boardwalk provides an innovative solution to overcome the existing physical constraint and to realise the vision of a joined up and easily accessible harbourfront.

The alignment works to utilise the shelter of the IEC as far as possible, so as to minimise the impact of the boardwalk on Victoria Harbour. The boardwalk will maintain a width of at least 10m to allow sufficient space for the safe and conflict-free shared use among different users including pedestrians, joggers, cyclists and other user groups. Other facilities include viewing platforms, fishing platform, toilets, drinking fountains and kiosks etc.

Photo source:
Civil Engineering and Development Department

cardContent.title: 卑路乍灣海濱長廊
info:
由棄置公眾貨物裝卸區改建而成的海濱長廊，於2019年3月至2020年10月分階段開放。為市民提供可飽覽維港和夕陽海景的消閒空間，體現各海濱優化的目標，包括善用閒置海濱土地、「先駁通、再優化」、引入多元海濱體驗及開放場地管理等。

相片來源：
規劃署

marker.name: 西營盤東邊街北休憩用地

cardContent.title: 西營盤東邊街北休憩用地
info:
休憩用地正以「先駁通，再優化」形式發展。首階段以「捐山窿公園」為主題於2019年開放。項目團隊透過實地視察和用家調查收集遊人經驗和建議，以期將提供足夠遮蔭、跨代共融遊樂設施及多用途空間等優化措施融入下一階段工程當中。有關工程預計於2024年起分階段完成。

相片來源：
中西區區議會

marker.name:
中西區海濱長廊—西區副食品
批發市場段

cardContent.title: 中西區海濱長廊—西區副食品批發市場段
info:
行政長官於2013年《施政報告》推出「社區重點項目計劃」。中西區區議會經討論及公眾參與活動後，決定以「美化及活化西區副食品批發市場的臨海地段」為社區重點項目。海濱長廊於2018年4月開放，提供跑步空間及長者運動設施，而四個碼頭設有不同主題，營造富有特色的「碼頭」公園。項目的設計保留了西區副食品批發市場及碼頭的風貌和歷史元素，反映批發市場行業特色，彰顯地區歷史。

相片來源：
規劃署

cardContent.title: 中環新海濱
info: 中環新海濱有政府管理的添馬公園和中西區海濱長廊-中環段，也有私人機構營運的中環海濱活動空間、香港摩天輪和香港海事博物館。多元的海濱管理模式，可以充分發揮民間創意、市場智慧和經驗，創造朝氣蓬勃、富吸引力的海濱。

marker.name:
添馬至香港會議展覽中心
海濱長廊

cardContent.title:
添馬至香港會議展覽中心
海濱長廊
info: 海濱長廊的臨海部分已於2019年10月開放，成為維港兩岸目前最長海濱長廊的一部份。下一階段於2021年5月開放的部分包括一個以「童樂園」（FunScape）為主題的活動區和連綿的綠化走廊等。沿途不時會展示由本地文創精英設計的「期間限定」互動裝置。

cardContent.title: 灣仔北慶典主題區
info:
此主題區的設計目標，是優化現時已開放的海濱，吸引及方便市民和遊客前往，以欣賞遼闊的海濱景色，以及為官式慶典活動提供莊嚴的場地。

相片來源：
規劃署

marker.name:
灣仔北渡輪
碼頭畔主題區

cardContent.title: 灣仔北渡輪碼頭畔主題區
info:
主題區自2020年年底起分階段開放。為盡收一望無際的海濱景色，用地引入相框和霓虹燈裝飾概念，提供大量「打卡位」。遊人不但可以靠岸的天星小輪和對岸的尖沙咀為背景拍照，更可在多個寬闊的有蓋空間進行多元化活動。

相片來源：
灣仔區議會

marker.name:
灣仔北水上運動
及康樂主題區

cardContent.title: 灣仔北水上運動及康樂主題區
info:
主題區自2020年年底起分階段開放。為了將公眾和水體的距離拉近，主題區設置海岸堤階和方便船隻上落的下水道和可拆卸欄杆。除推動於維港進行水上活動外，主題區亦是展示「期間限定」裝置和進行多元化活動的理想地點。

相片來源：
發展局

marker.name:
銅鑼灣活力
避風塘主題區

cardContent.title: 銅鑼灣活力避風塘主題區
info:
維園道附近的海濱長廊正進行提 升工程，並會引進新的海岸堤階，將公眾和水體的距離拉近。建築工程可望於2021年年底開始分階段完成。

相片來源：
發展局

marker.name:
炮台山東岸
公園主題區

cardContent.title: 炮台山東岸公園主題區
info:
部分用地將會從現時的工程提早釋出，並在美化後於2021年年底開始分階段率先開放供市民享 用。「維多利亞港」字型藝術裝置設計比賽的得獎作品將會在該處展示。整個作品長約40米、高約三米，從海港內亦能清楚見到。

相片來源：
發展局

marker.name:
東區走廊下之
行人板道

cardContent.title: 東區走廊下之行人板道
info:
現時由炮台山至鰂魚涌的海濱主要為私人住宅及商業發展項目、公眾設施、營運中的碼頭和東區走廊，部分海濱更是公眾無法使 用的。板道是創新的構思，透過沿海港的水體上方建造一條走道，克服現時的環境限制，以實現一條連貫及暢達的海濱。

走線盡量利用東區走廊結構下的遮蔭，將對維多利亞港的影響減至最低。板道寬度最少10米，讓不同人士（包括行人、緩跑人士、騎單車者和其他人士）可以安全共用並進行不同的活動。其他配套設施包括觀景台、釣魚平台、洗手間、飲水機和小食亭等。

相片來源：
土木工程拓展署

cardContent.title: Hung Hom Urban Park
info:
The site has been opened for public use after relocation of the public transport interchange thereon in January 2019 and completion of some simple greening works. It is now a piece of open space enjoyed by the public in an organic and joyful manner.

Photo source:
Planning Department

cardContent.title: 紅磡都市公園
info:
位於用地之上的公共運輸交匯處於2019 年1月遷離，經完成一些簡單的綠化工程後，該處已開放給公眾享用。市民目前可以有機和互動地享用這片休憩空間。

相片來源：
規劃署

cardContent.title: Kai Tak Metro Park
info: The Kai Tak Metro Park will be developed by phases. Certain parts of the project area designated as Dining Cove and the promenade-cum-open space near the Kai Tak Approach Channel could complete construction and be opened to the public by phases starting from 2023.  The Greenway to be shared use by pedestrians and cyclists along the future harbourfront of Kai Tak.

cardContent.title: Kowloon Bay Action Area
info: Planning and Engineering Feasibility Study for the Development at Kowloon Bay Action Area proposes a multi-level pedestrian network to connect the Kowloon Bay MTR Station, Kai Tak Development and Kwun Tong waterfront.

cardContent.title: Kwun Tong Promenade
info:
Kwun Tong Promenade has a total area of about 4.13 hectares. It was formerly Kwun Tong Public Cargo Working Area, which forms an integral part of Kai Tak Development. The waterfront boardwalk in the Promenade is about one kilometre long. Not only that visitors can enjoy a close-up views of the icons in Kowloon East - Kai Tak Cruise Terminal and the Runway Park, but also have a bird-eye view of the splendid night views of Hong Kong Island East and the panoramas of Victoria Harbour and Lei Yue Mun.

Photo source:
Planning Department

cardContent.title: Kwun Tong Action Area
info:
The Planning and Engineering Feasibility Study on Kwun Tong Action Area proposes to restructure the Government, Institution and Community (GIC) uses near the Kwun Tong Ferry Pier, improve the road capacity and pedestrian facilities, and enhance the harbourfront area. It proposes to integrate the waterfront promenade with the series of open spaces in the area to enhance the harbourfront connectivity, linking with Kwun Tong Waterfront Promenade, and with the future Tsui Ping River and Cha Kwo Ling waterfront.

Photo source:
Energizing Kowloon East Office

cardContent.title: Cha Kwo Ling Waterfront
info: Preparation is being made to formulate a design for the area, with a view to commencing the first phase of construction in 2025.

cardContent.title: 啟德都會公園
info: 啟德都會公園將會分階段發展。美食海灣的部分，以及啟德明渠進口道附近的部分海濱長廊和休憩用地，預計可於 2023年開始分階段完成建築工程，並開放予公眾使用。未來啟德的海濱亦會引進行人單車共融通道。

cardContent.title: 九龍灣行動區
info: 「九龍灣行動區發展規劃及工程可行性研究」建議將採用多層行人網絡，提供行人連接至港鐵九龍灣站及牛頭角站 、啟德發展區和觀塘海濱。

cardContent.title: 觀塘海濱花園
info:
觀塘海濱花園整體面積4.13公頃，前身為觀塘公眾貨物裝卸區，屬啟德發展計劃一部分。園內海濱步道全長約一公里。遊人在步道上不但可以近距離欣賞東九龍新地標 ─ 啟德郵輪碼頭和跑道公園，更可遠眺港島東的璀璨夜景，飽覽維多利亞港和鯉魚門的風光。

相片來源：
規劃署

cardContent.title: 觀塘行動區
info:
「觀塘行動區發展規劃及工程可行性研究」」建議重整現時在觀塘碼頭一帶的政府、設施用地的土地用途，改善該區道路容量及行人設施和提升海濱環境。建議結合海濱長廊及區內一系列的休憩空間，加強海濱長廊連接性，連接觀塘海濱花園，並延伸至未來的翠屏河及茶果嶺海濱。

相片來源：
起動九龍東辦事處

cardContent.title: 茶果嶺海濱
info: 擬訂海濱的設計正在準備中，以期於2025年展開第一期建築工程。

cardContent.title: West Kowloon Cultural District (WKCD)
info:
Flanking Victoria Harbour, WKCD is one of the largest cultural projects in the world, embracing art, education and open space. The vision of WKCD is to create a vibrant cultural quarter for Hong Kong where the local arts scene can interact, collaborate and develop. It includes a variety of arts and cultural facilities for producing and hosting world-class exhibitions, performances and arts and cultural events.
  • Lyric Theatre Complex
  • M+ museum of visual culture
  • Xiqu Centre
  • Art park

cardContent.title: 西九文化區
info:
座落維港海旁的西九文化區，是全球規模最大的文化項目之一，集藝術、教育及公共空間於一身。西九文化區的願景，是為香港創造一個多姿多彩的文化地帶，促進本地藝術界互動、合作與發展。區內將有並設有各種文化藝術設施，上演世界級展覽、表演節目和文化藝術活動。
  • 演藝綜合劇場
  • M+視覺文化博物館
  • 戲曲中心
  • 藝術公園
